hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget crisis, regulatory headlines) while funding rates remain neutral/positive, price will revert >60% of the drop within 48 hours as liquidity returns to fill the gap.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent budget crisis news caused sharp but shallow selloffs. When funding isn't excessively negative, these are often liquidity gaps rather than structural shifts. Market makers and opportunistic buyers step in when panic subsides.
entry_conditions: BTC 4h close down >5% from previous close
Negative macro news headline within past 6 hours (budget crisis, regulatory)
Aggregate funding rate across major exchanges between -0.01% and +0.02%
Cumulative volume delta (CVD) shows net selling but not capitulation (<2x normal selling volume)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 60% retracement of the initial 5%+ drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops another 3% below entry low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such events lead to continuation lower (beyond stop loss) rather than reversal within 48 hours.
